bibl.title: William W. Tinkham and Annie Ll. Tinkham v. David E. Kimble and A.B. Corriell. Order of the Court
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: Justice Court of Mount Vernon Precinct County of Skagit, Territory of Washington

body.p: Territory of Washington County of Skagit
To the Sheriff or any Constable of said County:

Whereas William W. Tinkham has this day complained in writing under oath, to the undersigned one of the Justices of the Peace in and for said County that he has just cause to fear and does fear David E. Kimble and A.B. Corriell of said county will do some great bodily injury to wit will beat strike or wound kill said William W. Tinkham and Annie Ll. Tinkham

Therefor in the name of the United States you are hereby commanded to apprehend the said David E. Kimble and A.B. Corriell and bring them forth with before me to show cause why he should not give surety to keep the peace and be of good
behavior towards all the people of this Territory, and the said William W. Tinkham and Annie Ll. Tinkham especially, and further to be dealt with according to law.
Given under my hand this 31st day of August 1887
John T. Mason Justice of the Peace
Territory of Washington } ss. County of Skagit

I hereby certify that I served the with warrant on the 1st day of Sep AD 1887 and that I served the same by taking into my custody David E. Kimble & A.B. Corriell the with in named defendents bringing them into court on this 1st day of Sept 1887
